text:
Hello

I try to craete contact info.
Type this code using powershell (5.1version and 7.2)
```curl.exe --request POST --url "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts?hapikey=$apiKey>" --header 'content-type: application/json' -d "{\"properties\": {\"email\":\"$email\",\"firstname\":\"$firstname\"}}"```
but error
```return {"status":"error","message":"Invalid input JSON on line 1, column 3: Unexpected character ('\\' (code 92)): was expecting double-quote to start field name","correlationId":"2086b3bc-abe5-4f90-a79c-213d45bb2a97"}```
I try this code using *single quote* after *-d*.
and then create contact info.
```curl.exe --request POST --url "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts?hapikey=$apiKey>" --header 'content-type: application/json' -d '{\"properties\": {\"email\":\"<mailto:xxx@yyy.co.jp|xxx@yyy.co.jp>\",\"firstname\":\"k\"}}'```
but I want to substitute variables.
Is anyone know why can't use double quote ?

Hi! I would need yoour help if possible.  A client is trying to connect his CRM with HubSpot Via API. We faced this situation:

We have some contact fields thattheir values need to be dynamycally changed via API. Meaning: if in CRM there is a new value for a field, it will need to be automatically created in HubSpot.  Ex. Field: Species - If in CRM they create value "dogs", we need that it will be automatically created in HubSpot (so no admin user has to add it manually)
Hi Lorena, can you please tell us which CRM your Client is using?
It is called "Qsoft" Client is a vets clinics so it is a crm made for them

Hello, Iâ€™m having an issue when I use the `POST /contacts/v1/contact/createOrUpdate/email/:contact_email` endpoint, after 2-3 attempts, its works.
The API returns an 400 with `"error":"INVALID_EMAIL","name":"email"` with @laposte.net email.
Does anyone had this issue ?
Can you post your json request?

topic: For conversation, not an official HubSpot support channel. For support help, please post in our API forum (with dedicated support reps) :point_right: Visit: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Developers/ct-p/developers>
text: set the channel topic: For conversation, not an official HubSpot support channel. For support help, please post in our API forum (with dedicated support reps) :point_right: Visit: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Developers/ct-p/developers>

does the CRM have the ability to fire webhooks?
From a HubSpot perspective, this is pretty standard, but we would need a way to
A:  know that an event occurred
B:  data about that event
I have not seen this on my end.  Any reason you are using the older endpoint instead of the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts|newer ones>?
